document.heading: Fiscal Year 2019 Revised Local Budget Temporary Adjustment Act of 2019
To adjust, on a temporary basis, certain allocations in the Fiscal Year 2019 Local Budget Act of 2018 pursuant to the Omnibus Appropriations Act, 2009.

history.summary: See "Other Documents" tab for the Amendment in the Nature of a Substitute.

document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Fiscal Year 2019 Revised Local Budget Temporary Adjustment Act of 2019".

section.text: Pursuant to section 817 of the Omnibus Appropriations Act, 2009, approved March 13, 2009 (123 Stat. 699; D.C. Official Code § 47-369.02), the Fiscal Year 2019 budget shall be adjusted as follows:

container.heading: SUMMARY OF EXPENSES
container.text: $57,610,000 is added (including an increase of $52,267,000 in local funds, a decrease of ($122,000) in dedicated taxes, an increase of $4,201,000 in other funds, and an increase of $1,264,000 in Medicaid payments), to be allocated as follows:

container.heading: Governmental Direction and Support
container.text: The appropriation for Governmental Direction and Support is increased by $14,245,000 in local funds, to be allocated as follows:

para.text: Department of General Services. – $13,587,000 is added in local funds;
Captive Insurance Agency – $1,322,000 is added in local funds;

Deputy Mayor for Greater Economic Opportunity. – ($500,000) is removed from local funds, from the funds available for the Workforce Investment Council for activities consistent with the DC Central Kitchen Grants Amendment Act of 2018, effective October 30, 2018 (D.C. Law 22-168; 65 DCR 9388);
Advisory Neighborhood Commissions. – $30,000 is added in local funds;
Office of Finance and Resource Management. – ($61,000) is removed from local funds;
Public Employee Relations Board. – ($33,000) is removed from local funds; and
Council of the District of Columbia. – ($100,000) is removed from local funds.

container.heading: Economic Development and Regulation
container.text: The appropriation for Economic Development and Regulation is decreased by ($1,587,000) (including a decrease of ($2,065,000) in local funds, a decrease of ($122,000) in dedicated taxes, and an increase of $600,000 in other funds), to be allocated as follows:

para.text: Office of Planning. – $1,083,000 is added in local funds;
Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs. – $500,000 is added in local funds and $600,000 is added in other funds;
Housing Production Trust Fund Subsidy. – ($3,184,000) is removed from local funds.
Office of the Tenant Advocate. – ($617,000) is removed from local funds;
Housing Authority Subsidy. – $53,000 is added in local funds;
Alcoholic Beverage Regulation Administration. – ($122,000) is removed from dedicated taxes; and
Office of Zoning. – $100,000 is added in local funds.

container.heading: Public Safety and Justice
container.text: The appropriation for Public Safety and Justice is increased by $5,294,000 (including an increase of $3,794,000 in local funds and an increase of $1,500,000 in Medicaid payments), to be allocated as follows:

para.text: Metropolitan Police Department. – $3,600,000 is added in local funds;
Fire and Emergency Medical Services Department. – $231,000 is added in local funds and $1,500,000 is added in Medicaid payments;
Department of Corrections. – $1,182,000 is added in local funds;
Office of Neighborhood Safety and Engagement. – ($265,000) is removed from local funds;
District of Columbia National Guard. – ($14,000) is removed from local funds;
Department of Forensic Sciences. – ($156,000) is removed from local funds;
Office of Police Complaints. – ($700) is removed from local funds;
Office of Administrative Hearings. – ($107,000) is removed from local funds;
Office of Unified Communications. – ($657,000) is removed from local funds; and
Office of Victim Services and Justice Grants. – ($20,000) is removed from local funds.

container.heading: Public Education System
container.text: The appropriation for Public Education System is decreased by ($4,249,000) in local funds, to be allocated as follows:

para.text: Office of the State Superintendent of Education. – $1,292,000 is added in local funds;
Non-Public Tuition. – ($500,000) is removed from local funds;
State Board of Education. – ($42,000) is removed from local funds; and
District of Columbia Public Charter Schools. – ($5,000,000) is removed from local funds.

container.heading: Human Support Services
container.text: The appropriation for Human Support Services is decreased by ($19,418,000) (including a decrease of ($19,182,000) in local funds and a decrease of ($236,000) in Medicaid payments), to be allocated as follows:

para.text: Office on Aging. – $2,250,000 is added in local funds;
Department of Parks and Recreation. – $1,744,000 is added in local funds;
Department of Health Care Finance. – ($10,296,000) is removed from local funds and ($236,000) is removed from Medicaid payments;
Department of Youth Rehabilitation Services. – ($7,945,000) is removed from local funds;
Child and Family Services Agency. – ($3,293,000) is removed from local funds.
Department of Health. – ($10,000) is removed from local funds;
Department of Human Services. – ($315,000) is removed from local funds;
Deputy Mayor for Health and Human Services. – ($231,000) is removed from local funds;
Department of Disability Services. – ($382,000) is removed from local funds;
Department of Behavioral Health. – ($205,000) is removed from local funds; and
Unemployment Compensation Fund. – ($500,000) is removed from local funds.

container.heading: Public Works
container.text: The appropriation for Public Works is increased by $9,886,000 (including an increase of $6,285,000 in local funds and an increase of $3,601,000 in other funds), to be allocated as follows:

para.text: Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority. – $13,578,000 is added in local funds;
District Department of Transportation. – ($965,000) is removed from local funds and $3,601,000 is added in other funds;
Department of Public Works. – ($4,947,000) is removed from local funds; and
Department of Motor Vehicles. – ($1,382,000) is removed from local funds.

container.heading: Financing and Other
container.text: The appropriation for Financing and Other is increased by $53,439,000 in local funds, to be allocated as follows:

para.text: Emergency and Contingency Reserve Funds. – $47,598,000 is added in local funds; and
Workforce Investments Account. – $5,841,000 is added in local funds.

section.codify:annotation: For an temporary (225-day) adjustment to certain allocations requested in the Fiscal Year 2019 Local Budget Act of 2018, see the Fiscal Year 2019 Revised Local Budget Temporary Adjustment Act of 2019, D.C. Law 23-10, August 24, 2019, 66 DCR 8069.

For an temporary (225-day) adjustment to certain allocations requested in the Fiscal Year 2019 Local Budget Act of 2018, see the Fiscal Year 2019 Revised Local Budget Temporary Adjustment Act of 2019, D.C. Law 23-10, August 24, 2019, 66 DCR 8069.

section.heading: Remaining Fiscal Year 2019 unexpended revenue of $26,010,000 shall be carried over into Fiscal Year 2020 as fund balance and shall be available as set forth in the approved Fiscal Year 2020 Budget and Financial Plan.
Capital adjustments.
section.text: In Fiscal Year 2019, the Chief Financial Officer shall rescind or adjust capital project allotments as set forth in the following tabular array, with the savings to be used in accordance with the Fiscal Year 2020 Local Budget Act of 2019, passed on 2nd reading on May 28, 2019 (Enrolled version of Bill 23-208):

tr.td: YARDS PARK AND CANAL PARK IMPROVEMENTS

para.text: Notwithstanding any provision of law limiting the use of funds in the accounts listed in the following chart, the Chief Financial Officer shall transfer in Fiscal Year 2019 the following amounts from certified fund balances and other revenue in the identified accounts to the General Fund of the District of Columbia:

tr.td: H Street NE Retail Priority Area Grant Fund
DC Circulator Bus System - NPS Mall Route
ABC - Import and Class License Fees
Public Vehicles for Hire Customer Service

para.text: The total amount identified in subsection (a) of this section shall be made available as set forth in the approved Fiscal Year 2020 Budget and Financial Plan.

Notwithstanding any provision of law, the Chief Financial Officer shall transfer in Fiscal Year 2019 the following amounts in the identified accounts to the unassigned fund balance of the General Fund of the District of Columbia:

Notwithstanding any provision of law, the Chief Financial Officer shall transfer in Fiscal Year 2019 $28,053,000 from the Cash Flow Reserve Account established pursuant to D.C. Official Code § 47-392.02(j-2) to the unassigned fund balance of the General Fund.
The $47,851,000 transferred to the unassigned fund balance of the General Fund pursuant to subsections (a) and (b) of this section shall be directed as follows:

$23,925,500 shall be deposited into the Emergency and Non-Emergency Number Telephone Calling Systems Fund, established by section 603(a) of the Emergency and Non-Emergency Number Telephone Calling Systems Fund Act of 2000, effective October 19, 2000 (D.C. Law 13-172; D.C. Official Code § 34-1802(a)), and shall be made available as set forth in the approved Fiscal Year 2020 Budget and Financial Plan; and

$23,925,500 shall be deposited into the DCHA Rehabilitation and Maintenance Fund, established by section 3(c-1) of the District of Columbia Housing Authority Act of 1999, effective May 9, 2000 (D.C. Law 13-105; D.C. Official Code § 6-202(c-1)).

section.text: Section 47-812(b-9)(2)(D)(ii) of the District of Columbia Official Code is amended to read as follows:

para.text: IST revenue collected during the period beginning on January 1, 2019 and ending on September 30, 2019, shall be directed to the unassigned balance of the General Fund for purposes consistent with the Fiscal Year 2019 Revised Local Budget Emergency Adjustment Act of 2019, passed on emergency basis on June 18, 2019 (Enrolled version of Bill 23-205).

section.text: Section 603(b) of the Emergency and Non-Emergency Telephone Calling Systems Fund Act of 2000, effective October 19, 2000 (D.C. Law 13-172; D.C. Official Code § 34-1802(b)), is amended as follows:

para.text: Paragraph (2) is amended by striking the phrase "; and" and inserting a semicolon in its place.
Paragraph (3) is amended by striking the period and inserting the phrase "; and" in its place.
A new paragraph (4) is added to read as follows:
Such amounts as may be appropriated or deposited into the Fund.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Chief Financial Officer as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

para.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), a 30-day period of congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Official Code § 1-206.02(c)(1)), and publication in the District of Columbia Register.
This act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.
